intro: Delphinium ruspolianum var. micranthum, commonly known as the Alpine larkspur, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and hairy. The flowers are blue to purple, arranged in spikes, and consist of two upper petals and three lower ones. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display.
